The provided Node.js code is a utility function to check if a given value is an instance of `ArrayBuffer`. It defines a variable `hasArrayBuffer` which checks if `ArrayBuffer` is available in the current environment. Then, it defines the function `isArrayBuffer` which takes a parameter `value`. The function checks if `value` is an instance of `ArrayBuffer` or if its string representation is '[object ArrayBuffer]', given that `hasArrayBuffer` is `true`. It then exports the `isArrayBuffer` function as a module.

'use strict';

const isArrayBuffer = (function() {
  const hasArrayBuffer = typeof ArrayBuffer === 'function';
  const toString = Object.prototype.toString;

  return function(value) {
    return hasArrayBuffer && (
      value instanceof ArrayBuffer || 
      toString.call(value) === '[object ArrayBuffer]'
    );
  };
})();

module.exports = isArrayBuffer;
